datafield.subfield: Title in Fihris makhṭūṭāt Dār al-Kutub al-Ẓāhirīyah:
Title in Fihris makhṭūṭāt Dār al-Kutub al-Ẓāhirīyah:
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 636
Origin: As appears in colophon on p.313, copied by ʻUmar ibn Ismāʻīl with transcription completed 9 Rajab 1035 [ca. 6 April 1626].
Accompanying materials: a. Acquisitions slip from Yahuda -- b. Inventory cataloguing slip in hand of Winifred Smeaton Thomas.
Former shelfmark: From interior of upper cover and label on fore edge flap "IL 402" (likely supplied by Yahuda, see acquisitions slip).

Binding: Pasteboards covered in light brown leather ; Type II binding (with flap) ; board linings in untinted laid paper ; spine lining in red and white striped textile ; upper and lower covers carry scalloped blind-stamped mandorla (filled with vegetal composition, similar to Déroche class. OAi 2) as well as tooled border in a series of rules ; sewn in white thread, two stations ; worked chevron endbands in red and cream, good condition ; overall in somewhat poor condition with much abrasion, staining, minor lifting of leather, upper and lower covers detaching at spine, etc. ; repairs in dark brown to black leather ; housed in box for protection.

Support: European laid paper with 7 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 28-30 mm. apart (horizontal), anchor in circle watermark (see p.104, etc.) and countermark with "C B" [?] under trefoil (see p.106, etc.) ; sturdy, medium cream in color, burnished.
Decoration: Keywords, excerpts of qaṣīdah being commented upon and some abbreviation symbols rubricated ; written area surrounded by red and black triple rule-border.

Script: Naskh ; elegant 'Syrian' or Turkish hand ; mainly serifless with slight effect of tilt to the left and of words descending to baseline (occasionally more exaggerated), quite rounded with curvilinear descenders (some rightward descenders majmūʻah), pointing mainly in distinct dots, kāf mashqqūah preferred (even final kāf), final yāʼ often unpointed.
Layout: Written in 21 lines per page ; frame-ruled.
Collation: 15 V(150), IV (158) ; almost exclusively quinions ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (mistakenly skips two pages between pp.9-10).

Colophon: "Scribal," rectangular, reads "ووافق الفراغ من تعليقه بكرة نهار الاثنين تاسع شهر رجب الفرد سنة خمسة وثلاثين والف على يد الفقير الراجي عفو ربه القدير عمر بن اسماعيل غفر الله له ولوالديه ولجميع المسلمين امين يا رب العالمين وصلى الله على سيدنا محمد وعلى اله وصحبه اجمعين والحمد لله رب العالمين ان تجد عيبا فسد الخللا جل من لا فيه عيب ولا علا"
Explicit: "فرض امر الصلاة والسلام على النبي المكرم صلى الله عليه وسلم توسلا الى الله العظيم الاعظم ... دعواهم فيها سبحانك اللهم وتحيتهم فيها سلام واخر دعواهم ان الحمد لله رب العالمين"

Incipit: "رب اشرح لي صدر ويسر لي امري ... الحمد لله هادي من يشاء الى سبيله ومغني من اختاره لمعرفته بنور يقينه عن اقامة برهانه ودليله ... اما بعد فان السلوك فرض عين بلا خلاف على الذكور والاناث والعبيد والاشراف ... وكتب السلوك كثيرة لا تكاد تحصر لكن من اجلها وانفعها واجمعها واخصرها كتاب سلك العين لاذهاب الغين تسمية المصطفى عليه الصلاة والسلام تأليف الشيخ العارف الرباني سيدي عبد القادر بن حبيب الصفدي من بلاد الشام ..."
Title from inscription on upper board lining.
Fihris makhṭūṭāt Dār al-Kutub al-Ẓāhirīyah: al-taṣawwuf. Dimashq : Majmaʻ al-Lughah al-ʻArabīyah bi-Dimashq, 1978,

Elegant copy of the commentary by ʻAlī ibn ʻAṭīyah ibn Ḥasan, ʻAlwān al-Ḥamawī (d.1530) on the Ṣūfī qaṣīdah in tāʼ by ‘Abd al-Qādir ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar ibn Ḥabīb al-Ṣafadī (d. 1509) entitled Silk al-ʻayn li-idhhāb al-ghayn.
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

Ownership statement on 'title page' (p.1) in name of Muṣṭafá al-Khazzī [?] ( مصطفى الخزي ) ; pen trials (probatio pennae) on 'title page' (p.1) "تجربة الخط بالقلم لا فلح من ظلم" and a statement referring to a transaction of rent payments (اجرة البيوت) for the year 1051 [1641 or 2] with funds received by Muḥammad al-ʻAṭṭār ( محمد العطار ) ; waqf statement in upper margin of page facing incipit page (p.3) and elsewhere throughout reads "وقف مدرسة الملكية" ; collation marks and statements (appear in brown ink on verso of final leaf of virtually every quire, see p.38, 298, etc.) ; occasional glosses and marginal corrections.
